chargeHist.descr: OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jacob J. Kufner was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jacob J. Kufner was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob J. Kufner in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State amend info. to add count of obstructing.   No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence on Ct. 3 and withholds sentence on Ct. 1.  Court gives felony admonishment. 

Count 1:
4 years Probation
1 yr. SCJ, w/work release (waived 1st 48 hours), w/good time, consecutive to Ct. 3 and any other.  Commence on or before Feb. 2, 2015 @ 6 pm
2 days credit
DNA sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
36 mos revoc.
IID
$1744.00 F/C + $25.00 blood draw fee & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)

Count 3:
$443.00 costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
6 mos. in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive to Ct. 1 and any other.  
1 day credit

Count 2: Dismissed
Paperwork handed in court

Defendant Jacob J. Kufner appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does not qualify for PD representation.  State requests $2500.00 Cash bond.  Atty. Steinman makes bail argument, requests signature bond or lower cash.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  $2000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not operate m/v w/o valid DL; Absolute Sobriety; Submit to chemical testing if requested; Not operate m/v w/any minor children.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 11:45 am.
